alert.note: Alert for Pima (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Dust Advisory issued May 14 at 2:42PM MST until May 14 at 3:45PM MST by NWS Tucson
info.description: The National Weather Service in Tucson has issued a * Dust Advisory for... Northeastern Pima County in southeastern Arizona... * Until 345 PM MST. * At 242 PM MST, a dust channel was over Davis-Monthan Air Force Base, moving northwest at 25 mph. HAZARD...Less than one half mile visibility with strong wind in excess of 45 mph. SOURCE...Detected by National Weather Service meteorologists. IMPACT...Hazardous travel. * This includes the following highways... Interstate 10 between mile markers 244 and 279. Interstate 19 between mile markers 49 and 63. Route 77 between mile markers 70 and 79. Route 86 between mile markers 166 and 171. Locations impacted include... Tucson, Oro Valley, Marana, Sahuarita, Davis-Monthan Air Force Base, Casas Adobes, Drexel Heights, Flowing Wells, Tanque Verde, Vail, South Tucson, Pascua Pueblo Yaqui Reservation, Tortolita, Sabino Canyon Recreation Area, Summit, Catalina Foothills, Tucson International Airport, Saguaro National Park East, Tucson Estates and Rita Ranch. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Blowing dust brings reduced visibility, leading to dangerous driving conditions. If driving, avoid blowing dust if possible. If caught in dense blowing dust, pull off the road, turn off your lights and keep your foot off the brake.
